snippet: The strife-torn Aceh Province passed a bylaw last month that declared the banner of a former armed separatist movement to be the province’s official flag and seal.
abstract: Indonesian government gives leaders of strife-torn Aceh Province deadline to annul bylaw passed in March 2013 that declares banner from former armed separatist movement, Free Aceh Movement, to be province’s official flag and seal; officials say bylaw violates multiple national laws against separatism, an extremely delicate issue in Indonesia given the secession of East Timor in 1999.
lead_paragraph: The strife-torn Aceh Province passed a bylaw last month that declared the banner of a former armed separatist movement to be the province’s official flag and seal.

headline.seo: Indonesia Warns Aceh Province Over Flag
headline.main: Rebel Flag Flies Over a Province, and Indonesia Wants It Torn Down
headline.print_headline: Rebel Flag Flies Over a Province, and Indonesia Wants It Torn Down
